title: This Roguelike Kung Fu Game Is Free For 24 Hours On The Epic Games Store
description: Since it's the festive season, Epic is once again giving away a free game every day. The Epic Games Store continues to give away a free game each week, and this week is another nice find with a price that can't be beaten. Every Thursday at 8 AM PT / 11 AM ET, Epic offers at least one free PC game (and sometimes even as many as two or three). All you need to do to claim the free games is create a free Epic account and enable two-factor authentication. You have a week to add the freebies to your library before the new one(s) take their place. At this point, Epic has given away hundreds of free games, and there's no sign that the program will stop any time soon. We keep this article up to date weekly to highlight both the current free games and next week's offerings.Current free game at EpicSifu Sifu is the final free game of 2024 from the Epic Games Store. A roguelike brawler, Sifu is a tough game with a great story that asks you how far you'd be willing to go to exact revenge on the people who murdered your family. If you fall in battle, a magical amulet will bring you back to life, but there's a steep price to pay with every revival.Continue Reading at GameSpot
excerpt: Epic is giving out free games every day during the festive season.
text: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links. Since it's the festive season, Epic is once again giving away a free game every day. The Epic Games Store continues to give away a free game each week, and this week is another nice find with a price that can't be beaten. Every Thursday at 8 AM PT / 11 AM ET, Epic offers at least one free PC game (and sometimes even as many as two or three). All you need to do to claim the free games is create a free Epic account and enable two-factor authentication. You have a week to add the freebies to your library before the new one(s) take their place. At this point, Epic has given away hundreds of free games, and there's no sign that the program will stop any time soon. We keep this article up to date weekly to highlight both the current free games and next week's offerings.Current free game at EpicSifuSifu is the final free game of 2024 from the Epic Games Store. A roguelike brawler, Sifu is a tough game with a great story that asks you how far you'd be willing to go to exact revenge on the people who murdered your family. If you fall in battle, a magical amulet will bring you back to life, but there's a steep price to pay with every revival.December 19: Vampire SurvivorsDecember 20: Astrea Six-Sided OraclesDecember 21: TerraTechDecember 22: Wizard of LegendDecember 23: Dark and Darker: Legendary Status upgradeDecember 24: DredgeDecember 25: ControlDecember 26: Ghostrunner 2December 27: Hot Wheels UnleashedDecember 28: Kill KnightDecember 29: Orcs Must Die 3December 30: RedactedDecember 31: SifuNext free game at EpicThe next free game is a mystery, as Epic is keeping it under festive wrapping paper for now. Epic will be doing daily giveaways like it has in past, as December typically sees the company offer free games over two weeks. Last year there were some fun surprises, like DNF Duel, The Outer Worlds: Spacer's Edition, and Art of Rally.Epic Games Store free games listWe're keeping a running list of every free game that Epic users have been able to claim in the past. From AAA hits to indie darlings, Epic has really made its mark with free games. You can even snag these games if you don't have a powerful PC so you can play them if you ever get one. Look at the list below to see the frankly ridiculous list of free games that have been available.GameDateSifuDecember 31 - January 1, 2025RedactedDecember 30-31, 2024Orcs Must Die 3December 29-30, html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Since it's the festive season, Epic is once again giving away a free game every day. The Epic Games Store continues to give away a free game each week, and this week is another nice find with a price that can't be beaten. Every Thursday at 8 AM PT / 11 AM ET, Epic offers at least one free PC game (and sometimes even as many as two or three). All you need to do to claim the free games is create a free Epic account and enable two-factor authentication. You have a week to add the freebies to your library before the new one(s) take their place. At this point, Epic has given away hundreds of free games, and there's no sign that the program will stop any time soon. We keep this article up to date weekly to highlight both the current free games and next week's offerings.

Current free game at Epic

Sifu is the final free game of 2024 from the Epic Games Store. A roguelike brawler, Sifu is a tough game with a great story that asks you how far you'd be willing to go to exact revenge on the people who murdered your family. If you fall in battle, a magical amulet will bring you back to life, but there's a steep price to pay with every revival.

  • December 19: Vampire Survivors
  • December 20: Astrea Six-Sided Oracles
  • December 21: TerraTech
  • December 22: Wizard of Legend
  • December 23: Dark and Darker: Legendary Status upgrade
  • December 24: Dredge
  • December 25: Control
  • December 26: Ghostrunner 2
  • December 27: Hot Wheels Unleashed
  • December 28: Kill Knight
  • December 29: Orcs Must Die 3
  • December 30: Redacted
  • December 31: Sifu

Next free game at Epic

The next free game is a mystery, as Epic is keeping it under festive wrapping paper for now. Epic will be doing daily giveaways like it has in past, as December typically sees the company offer free games over two weeks. Last year there were some fun surprises, like DNF Duel, The Outer Worlds: Spacer's Edition, and Art of Rally.

Epic Games Store free games list

We're keeping a running list of every free game that Epic users have been able to claim in the past. From AAA hits to indie darlings, Epic has really made its mark with free games. You can even snag these games if you don't have a powerful PC so you can play them if you ever get one. Look at the list below to see the frankly ridiculous list of free games that have been available.
